citation.article-title: Pelagibius litoralis gen. nov., sp. nov., a marine bacterium in the family Rhodospirillaceae isolated from coastal seawater.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Pelagibius (Pe.la.gi.bi′us. L. n. pelagus the sea; N.L. masc. n. bius from Gr. n. bios life; N.L. masc. n. Pelagibius sea life).
Cells are Gram-negative, strictly aerobic, non-fermentative heterotrophs.
The dominant fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C18 : 0 3-OH and C19 : 0 cyclo ω8c.
The major isoprenoid quinone is ubiquinone 10 (Q-10).
Phylogenetically, the genus is a member of the family Rhodospirillaceae.
The type species is Pelagibius litoralis.
